intro: Phytarrhiza lindenii var. regeliana, commonly known as the velvetleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, violet to purple flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. Its berries are toxic to humans and animals, making it a plant to be handled with care.
